item.title: LDAP Importer
item.description: Strichliste just got a new, experimental command! You can now import users from a LDAP source. See the documentation here at our Commands.md for more details! You can also let this run as a cronjob to update the users mailaddress or create new ones as they appear in your LDAP directory. Feedback is appreciated!

item.title: Strichliste 2 released!
item.description: After a lot of concept work, strichliste 2 has now a stable API and also a well designed front-end. We’ve also changed our tech stack completely. Instead of node.js in the backend, and angular js in the front-end, we’re now using a symfony based PHP backend providing the API and also command-line tools for several tasks. The new frontend is completely responsive and uses react and redux as it’s core components.

item.title: Install strichliste
item.description: For strichliste to run, PHP 7.1 or higher is required. You should have a webserver running which supports mod_php or php-fpm. Installing Go to the Github project to download the latest release. It comes already with a bundled front-end. Extract the package content to your target directory (e.g. tar xvfz strichliste.tar.gz -C /var/www/strichliste.yourdomain.tld) Move the database in var/ from app.db.example to app.db if you want to use the default sqlite setup.

item.title: Static builds are now available!
item.description: Now it’s easier to setup your strichliste instance, because we now provide static builds for strichliste-web! You can easily grab the latest build from github and follow the install instructions. We’re currently working on major features. Stay tuned for the next major release

item.title: More features to come
item.description: Stay tuned for more features! We’re now working on some wanted features in the next strichliste release. These features are: money transfer, splitting bills, cancellation of the last order within a specific time range and we’re preparing the database for articles

item.title: What is this project about?
item.description: strichliste ([ʃtʀɪçˈlɪstə], German word for tally sheet) is a tool to replace a tally sheet inside a hackerspace. It’s aim is to provide a no-frills, easy-to-setup and -to-use solution for managing your organization’s snack bar. Demo That’s what you’re here for, right? You can access a demo of strichliste here.
